result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin P. Hallman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: in lieu of $543 costs; w/Huber, Consecutive to 90 days sentence but Concurrent with 13CM1988

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin P. Hallman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dustin P. Hallman in court in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily to count 2; Count 1 Dismissed and Read In; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 90 days RCJail, Concurrent with 13CM1988, w/Huber, $543 costs - 11 days RCJail in lieu of costs, Consecutive to 90 days, but concurrent with 13CM1988. Sentence Credit of 88 days

Defendant Dustin P. Hallman in court in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference on March 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
